name: Upwards (hahaitsjeff)
description:
You find yourself at the bottom of a stone tower. It's cold, but not uninviting. If you choose to climb, why do you choose to climb? Because it's the only way forward?

This is a short game with a tall stone tower. Content warning: brief, vague mentions of animal harm, self-harm and suicide.

Controls: WASD to move, mouse to look, Escape to quit.

This game was made over the week of 11/15/2020, as the ninth in my deck of many games, where I try to make a game a week, every week, for a year.

Credits:

Music: Classic Horror 1 by Kevin MacLeod
Link: https://incompetech.filmmusic.io/song/3511-classic-horror-1
License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

Font: UnZialish, by Manfred Klein: https://www.dafont.com/unzialish.font

Sound effects:
Steps
https://opengameart.org/content/platformer-sounds-terminal-interaction-door-shot...
Blowing wind
https://opengameart.org/content/strong-wind-blowing

Game built by me in Godot engine

Hero image made by me in Krita
